text: On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear gold with a medium sized white head. Soft citrus, musk, wheat on the nose. Medium bodied, soft sweetness, wheat, a bit of orange dances through some floral notes with wheat, and even some crisp citrus hoppiness. Very cool things going on here, bordering on that greenness that I dont like, but it lurks in the back and mostly turns to mango and tropical fruit notes. Slow crisp bitterness, super easy drinking. Light, pretty, lovely.

Half liter bottle from Beer Run, 7/20/16. Slightly hazy pale yellow, large foamy off-white head, good retention Aroma of wheat, lime and grapefruit. The taste is wheat, grapefruit, lime, white grape, very, very faint floral notes. Thin-medium bodied, refreshing. Youre welcome!
500 ml. Pale yellow. Very clean aroma. Pine and orange juice. Insanely thin mouthfeel. Pine with bitter orange peel and cream of. Wheat.
Bottle: pours light straw with foamy white head, hoppy aroma, taste is hoppy, some citrus and light sweetness, very dry finish

500 ml bottle from the brewery. Unclear yellow put with a frothy white head and plenty of lacing. Fruity aroma mostly (peach, melon, kiwi, etc.) with some wheat and spice notes and a bit of cracker too. Flavor is fruity and hoppy, the wheat and spice come through on the close. Really nice beer. No complaints from me.

22 oz bottle. Pours golden with tall, long lasting, fluffy white head, nice lacing and lively carbonation. Aroma is of citrusy hops, ripe fruit and bready malt. Body is medium and smooth. Citrusy, piney hops, bready malt and ripe fruit fill the mouth. Finish is long and dry. Good brew.

500ml bottle pours out a golden topped with a white head. Nose is crazy reminds me of fruit loop cereal sweet grassy hops and a nice tropical kick. Taste is more of the sweetness rich juicy fruit and some grassy earth on the end.

Bottle from Meditrina. Very pale slightly hazy gold with lasting head and lace. Dank hop aroma with lemon and mint and wheat tang. Mild pineapple apricot grassy sweetness with light fresh fruit tang and very dry spicy finish. Light body and lively carbo. So refreshing and delicious in this heat. I was worried because I usually hate "wheat ale" but this is wheat ale that tastes like very dry tropical IPA. FUCKING NAILED IT!

Bottled 6/26/16, drunk 7/9/16.A light cloudiness shows throughout this flaxen-gold beer. White head is medium-sized, rocky and fairly persistent.Very dry, wheat-tinged biscuit and cracker malts are joined by the house yeast character (earth, ash, light pepper perhaps) while lemony hops perk up. Some soft marmalade character is added, with a touch of grapefruit pith and minimal pine. Patience is rewarded with softer, lightly juicy citrus emerging with warming, as well as a touch of honey-tinged vanilla-like maltiness. No flaw or alcohol.Buttery up front, its at least a dry diacetyl character and becomes more popcorn-like and less savory butter-like. The palate mostly accustoms to it and the delicate hops add citrus and moderate bitterness to overcome. Tight carbonation, dry and with a slick-to-wheaty texture overall. Could use a bit more softness and juiciness, but I guess thats not what theyre going for here. Oh ya, and lose the diacetyl....
UPDATED: JUL 20, 2016 Bottler. Poured a hazy gold with large head. Got some floral, berries, acidity in the happy finish.
Lilly, marigold, rosehip. Clear golden, thin head. Well hopped lillies.Light to medium body, easy carbonation.

bottle pour..light golden yellow color. not much head but some large carbonation at first that settles down..nose is interesting for the style with a combo of earthy, floral,grassy, herbal n leafy hop aromas in play..pretty interesting mouthfeel. mostly picking up the lime zest as described on bottle, not getting much of the other descriptors but possibly some cantaloupe, mostly light bodied but does have a long,lingering finish with a crisp, yet smooth feel, seems to also be some kiwi n lemongrass as well, interesting for the style
Pours straw into a shaker. Bright white head with good retention recedes to hug rim. Sweet hay and lemon aromas. Soft with bread and hay turning to tropical mango and citrus in the lasting finish.

16.9 oz bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Bottled on 6/22/2016. Clear light yellow with a finger of off-white head. Aromas of citrus, subtle wheat, light floral notes. Tastes of citrus, wheat, light floral notes. Medium body with a dry finish. Tasty citrusy wheat ale.

Bottle from brewery, packaged on 6/22/16. Poured into a tulip glass, clear effervescent yellow with a thin white head, moderate lacing. Lager-like appearance. Cracker, biscuit and slight peppery cheese aroma, crisp malt notes with a wheat backbone. Medium dry bodied. Very sessionable.

Pours a medium golden color with three fingers of white foam. Typical hop forward MBC offering with layers of melon, citrus, hints of tropical notes and some well structured malt. FIzzy carbonation mingles nicely with the fruity wheat and carries the hop flavors to the forefront of the palate. Dry aggressive finish with bitter earthy hop notes lingering. Tasty especially if it were 10.99 a six pack but at $7.49 a bottle I dont think I would ever buy it again...

500ml bottle in a teku. Pours light golden with a white head. Aroma of citrusy and resinous and lightly fruity hops, some pale malts and wheat, and light dough. Flavor the same with a nice hoppiness. Average texture. A solid beer.

This was poured into an English pub glass.
The appearance was a glossy burnt yellow color with a thin white foamy head that dissipated at a nice pace. Thin lacing returns to the edge of the glass.
The smell starts off with some light wheat/grassiness/somewhat like hay. Then some light sweet melon returns within and slides in and around a light spice somewhat like black pepper. Fresh return of that "water-nutrient" enriched citrusy tones.
The flavor takes all of the previously mentioned flavors and brings it all together with a sweet hop oily residue sliding over my taste buds. Nicely restrained sweet wheaty/melon/berry/citrus aftertaste with a quick sweet finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light on the body with a nice sly oily sesssionable feel to it. Im thinking MBC used their house yeast to assist in allowing the whet to be fairly tame in this one.
Overall, definitely a wonderful APWA made by a stellar company. I would love to have this again.

Bottle during my "stag" and then again upon return home. Pours a clear light bright yellow, thin white head w/ some bubbly froth. aroma is guava, melon, berries, grass, hay, wheat, pine. Flavor is wheat, melon, grass, kiwi. Light sessionable Dank hoppy wheat beer, light enjoyable but complex flavors

Bottle shared during Sander Stag. Pours clear yellow-gold with a frothy, white head. Wow aroma, big and dank, some grapefruit, skunk, weed. Light-medium sweet flavour with tons of juicy citrus, melon, more dank skunk, pale bread. Light to medium bodied with massaging carbonation. Finishes with light resin, more grapefruit and melon, faint piney bitterness. Super.
